STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
March 20, 2025
Derrick McCree
LINCOLN CENTER
1961 LINCOLN ST,
HIGHLAND PARK, MI, 48203-3077
Re: License #: CI820293953
SI #: 2025SIC0000290
Dear Derrick McCree:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Samantha Way at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Nabiha Rizk, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2025SIC0000290
Special Investigation Intake Date: January 14, 2025
License #: CI820293953
Licensee Group Organization: Spectrum Juvenile Justice Services
Licensee Designee: Derrick McCree
Chief Administrator: Derrick McCree
Agency Name: LINCOLN CENTER
Agency Address: 1961 LINCOLN ST
HIGHLAND PARK, MI 48203-3077
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 07/30/2026
Capacity: 90
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Method Contact Purpose
03/19/2025 2:00 PM Phone interview
03/18/2025 4:00 PM Documentation MDHHS-No finding
2/12/2025 4:00 PM Video Conference MDHHS Pre-Disposition Meeting
1/21/2025 11:15 AM Onsite Inspection Interview
1/14/2025 2:00 PM Onsite Inspection Unannounced Visit: Interview
Documentation received
1/14/2025 12:00 PM Phone Incident Notification
1/14/2025 11:30 AM Phone Special Investigation Initiation
1

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Criminal history check, subject to requirements; Staff
Title qualifications.
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; Staff qualifications.
Description (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(a) Routine and emergency medical, and dental, and behavioral
health care.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 1/04/25, youth self-harmed with a pen and caused significant
injury to the right forearm, but he was not seen by a medical
profession until 1/9/25. The injury will require surgery and was
recently observed to be infected
Investigation Complainant was interviewed on 01/14/2025. No additional
information as provided.
Administrator was interviewed at the facility on 01/14/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Administrator reported Youth
A was seen by Nurse on 01/04/2025 and on 01/07/2025 due to a
self-inflicted wound. He said a follow up consultation was made for
him to be seen by a specialist at Children’s Hospital on
01/09/2025.
Youth A was interviewed at the facility on 01/14/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Youth A has been at the
facility for 6 months and is currently placed on Pod D. Youth A
admitted that stabbed his arm with a pen on 01/04/2025 and was
examined by the nurse on 01/04/2025. Youth A said he was also
examined by a doctor offsite and was told he may need to have
surgery to remove the tip of the pen. He thinks the tip of the pen is
still in his arm because the area where he stuck the pen is black.
Youth A said he was prescribed medicine and ointment cream.
Nurse was interviewed on 03/19/2025 via telephone. Nurse
confirmed she examined Youth A on 01/04/2025 and 01/07/2025
for a self-inflicted wound to his right arm. She said an X-ray was
ordered, antibiotic was prescribed, and an appointment was made
to see a specialist at Children’s hospital.
2

Documentation Reviewed:
• Medical Assessment note: Youth A was seen on
01/04/2025 for abrasion on his right arm due to biting his
arm and poking his arm with a pen. Youth A seen on
01/07/2025 Youth A’s arm was x-rayed, redness
surrounding area, and mild swelling. Cleaned wound and
provided antibiotic. Scheduled appointment with Children’s
Hospital on 01/09/2025.
• Children’s Hospital discharge instructions dated
01/09/2025, Youth A did not require surgery.
• Emergency Medical Services policy. When a resident is in
the care and custody of the facility and is in need of
emergency medical care, the Supervisor is to take the
youth to the on-duty Nurse for treatment and evaluation:
during non-nursing hours the supervisor is to contact the
on-call Facility Physician or Psychiatrist for further
directions. The staff will follow the directions of the
physician, and an unusual incident report must be
completed. If a youth is not breathing, unconscious, has a
fraction uncontrolled bleeding during non-nursing hours the
supervisor is to call 911 for emergency services.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per staff interviews and
documentation youth was seen by the nurse 01/4/2025 and on
01/07/2025 for self-harming and was again taken off sight for a
follow up appointment on 01/09/2025.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 1/12/25, the youth became upset and started throwing chairs.
Staff 1 was sent to assist in getting the youth to their room. Once
in the room, the Staff 1 shoved the youth into their room. Youth
attempted to assault Staff 1, and Staff 1 responded by punching
the youth in the face. Two staff members assisted Staff 1 in
3

restraining the youth by putting the youth face down on the bed
and in a chokehold causing the youth to be unable to breathe for
almost 30 seconds.
Investigation Administrator was interviewed at the facility on 01/14/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Administrator reported there
was an incident on 01/12/2025 involving Youth A was escalated
throwing chairs and assaulted Staff 1. He said Staff 1 has been
removed from the pod and will not be working with Youth A
pending the investigation.
Youth A was interviewed at the facility on 01/14/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Youth A reported on
01/12/2025 he was upset and started throwing chairs. Staff 1
came on the pod and was trying to get to go to his room. Youth A
admitted he initially refused but then agreed and went to room. He
said Staff 1 came in his room and was talking to him, and that’s
when he punched Staff 1 several times in the head. Youth A was
standing on his bed, and Staff 1 picked Youth A up, threw him on
the bed, kneed him in the face, and put him in a chokehold. He
said Staff 2 and Staff 3 came in the room and put him in a restrain.
He said Staff 1 made him angry and that’s why he punched him.
Youth A said he got a bruise on his face from the incident and was
examined by the nurse after the incident.
Youth B was interviewed at the facility on 01/21/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Youth B is placed on Pod D.
Youth B recalled the incident on 01/12/2025, he reported Youth A
was upset, started flipping tables and chairs. Youth A went to his
room with Staff 1. Youth B said he heard from Youth A that Staff 1
choked him when he was in his room. Youth B didn’t see Staff 1
choke or restrain Youth A, but he heard Youth A say, “I can’t
breathe”.
Youth C was interviewed at the facility on 01/21/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Youth C has been at the
facility for 7 months and is placed on Pod D. Youth C reported on
01/12/2025 he was standing with Staff 2 and Staff 3 outside Youth
A’s room. He witnessed Youth A hitting Staff 1, and that’s when
Staff 2 and Staff 3 went in to assist. He said Youth A was saying “I
can’t breathe” but the Staff were not touching Youth A. He said
Youth A was jumping around trying to hit the Staff 1, and that’s
when Staff 2 and Staff 3 restrained Youth A by holding his arms to
the side. He denied witnessing any staff hit, punch, or choke
Youth A. He said Youth A was the one hitting staff.
4

Staff 1 was interviewed at the facility on 01/21/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Staff 1 has been employed at
the facility for two years. He reported on 01/12/2025 he went to
Pod D to assist, because Youth A was escalated and being
destructive. When he got to the pod Youth A was yelling and
throwing chairs. After talking to Youth A for several minutes he
was able to verbally de-escalate and get him to go to his room.
Once in his room he was talking to Youth A about his behavior
and that’s when Youth A jumped on his bed and punched him
several times before Staff 2 and Staff 3 came in the room. He said
Youth A went wild hitting, kicking, and throwing himself around the
room. Staff 2 and Staff 3 were able to place Youth A in a two
person hold for one minute. He denied hitting, kneeing, or choking
Youth A. He did not observe any injuries on Youth A after the
incident.
Staff 2 was interviewed at the facility on 01/21/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Staff 2 reported she and Staff
1 responded to assist with the incident involving Youth A on
01/12/2025. Youth A was escalated, throwing chairs, flipping
tables, and threatening staff. Staff 1 verbally de-escalate Youth A
and got him to go to his room. Staff 1 was in the room with Youth
A counseling him and she and Staff 3 were standing outside
Youth A’s room. While in bedroom Youth A became agitated again
and assaulted Staff 1, so she and Staff 3 went in the room to
assist Staff 1. She said Youth A punched Staff 1 on the head,
kicking her, and was jumping around the room slapping himself in
the face. She said Staff 1 never touched Youth A while he was in
the room with Youth A. Youth A was screaming “I can’t breathe”
but no one was choking or holding him down. She said Youth A
slipped and fall on his side by the stool when he was jumping
around the room. She and Staff 3 did a two person hold on Youth
A with each staff holding one arm with his wrist and elbow. She
spoke with Youth A after the incident and Youth A did not report
having any injuries or experiencing any pain. Youth A did tell her
that he hit his face on the wall. She said Youth A was examined
by the nurse after the incident.
Staff 3 was interviewed at the facility on 01/21/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Staff 3 confirmed he was
standing outside Youth A’s room on 01/12/2025 and didn’t witness
Staff 1 choke, knee, or slam Youth A on the floor. He said Youth A
was the one that assaulted Staff 1. Youth A was jumping around
the room from the bed to the desk and stool. Youth A did slip and
fall on the floor when he was jumping around the room. He said
5

they attempted twice to restrain Youth A, the first time Youth A
dropped to the floor, and they released him. He and Staff 2 were
able to restrain him the second time in a two person hold while
standing with his wrist and elbow held. He said Youth A did say he
can’t breathe, but only so that they release the hold. He said at no
point was Youth A placed on the bed or in a choke hold. Staff 3
said Youth A did not have any bruises when left off the pod after
the incident.
Staff 4 was interviewed at the facility on 01/21/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Staff 4 confirmed was working
on 01/12/2025 on Pod D. She said Youth A was escalated,
throwing chairs, and refusing to step down. Staff 1 and Staff 2
came on the pod to assist. Staff 4 denied witnessing Staff 1
assault Youth A in his room. She said Youth A was the aggressive
and threatening Staff 1. She was working with the other youths on
the pod and didn’t witness the incident in the room. She further
denied hearing Youth A say he could not breathe. She said often
Youth’s will say they cannot breathe to avoid being restrained.
She said after the incident Youth A appeared to be fine and did
not complain about any pain, however he did have some
scratches on his face.
Staff 6 was interviewed at the facility on 01/21/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Staff 6 confirmed he was
standing outside the Youth A’s room on 01/12/2025 after Staff 2
and Staff 3 went to assist Staff 1. He did witness Youth A punch
Staff 1, but denied witnessing Staff 1 hit, choke, or slam Youth A
on the bed. Staff 6 said he did hear Youth A say I can’t breathe,
but Staff 2 and Staff 3 were attempting to do a two-person
standing restrain. He denied witnessing Youth A was being
choked or held down on his bed by staff. Youth A was observed to
have scratches on his face and Staff 6 asked him about the
scratches and Youth A said he does not know how.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage from 01/12/2025 was reviewed. At approximately
9:46 pm Youth A is observed walking around, throws a chair at the
ceiling and breaks ceiling tiles, continues picking up chairs and
throwing at the ceiling, Staff 1 comes on the pod and is talking to
Youth A, Youth A appears to be arguing with Staff 1. Staff 1
appears to be verbally trying to get Youth A to his room and Youth
A slams his bedroom door and starts walking around the pod.
There is audio, but the sound quality is not clear and could not
distinguish what is being said. Youth A appears to be yelling and
6

arguing with Staff 1 and Staff 1 appears to be yelling back at
Youth A. At 09:55 pm Youth A goes to his bedroom willingly, Staff
1 follows Youth A to his bedroom, the door is opened halfway,
Staff 2 and Staff 3 are standing outside the bedroom with Youth B.
At 9:56 pm Staff 2 and Staff 3 enter Youth A’s bedroom. Staff 6
comes and stands outside the bedroom with Youth B still standing
at the door. At 9:58 Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 exit Youth A’s
bedroom and close the bedroom door.
Documents Reviewed:
• Unusual incident report dated 01/12/2025, written by
Manager. Youth A was upset, began throwing chairs at the
ceiling damaging ceiling tiles. Staff 1 and Staff 2 came on
the pod to assist. Staff 1 asked Youth A to go to his room,
Youth A went to his room, Staff 1 followed Youth A to
counsel with him, Youth A assaulted Staff 1 by punching
him in the face several times, Staff 2 and Staff 3 entered
the room to assist. Staff 2 and Staff 3 placed Youth A in a
two arm hold for 2 minutes. Staff 3 counseled with Youth A
about his behavior.
• Medical Assessment noted dated 01/12/2025. Youth A was
examined and noted Youth A had abrasion on his left side
of his face, topical ointment applied, zero pain and
discomfort. Youth A reported Staff 1 assaulted him while in
his room.
• Staff 1 has no disciplinary record. Staff 1 completed
MANDT verbal and de-escalation and physical skills
training on 08/29/2024 and 09/05/2024.
• Youth Discipline & Behavior Modification Policy states any
type of physical discipline is prohibited. The use of verbal
and non-physical crisis intervention should be utilized first
and may prevent the need for physical intervention. A youth
initiating physical contact with a staff or another person with
the intent of controlling or harming that person and/or picks
up something to use as a weapon is considered a physical
assault. The appropriate staff response is to use a safe
physical management procedure to control the youth and
then use the Behavior Management Procedure until the
youth is under physical and emotional control.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as there is insufficient evidence
youth was put in a chokehold or hurt by staff. All the staff and
youth that witnessed the incident denied Youth A was choked or
hurt by staff while he was in his room. It could not be determined
what caused the bruising on Youth A’s, because Youth A did fall
on his side, and was also slapping himself. Documentation
7

provided confirmed Youth A was examined and received medical
care after he was restrained.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction, prevention;
Title prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159
Section (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
Description manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth's behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth's
treatment plan
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 1/10/25, a staff member restrained this youth and caused a 3–
4-inch scratch near the center of the youth's chest.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed at the facility on 01/14/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Youth A reported on
01/10/2025, he and Youth B were goofing around and that’s when
Staff 5 pulled Youth A and ripped his shirt. Youth A said he swung
at Staff 5 and that’s when Staff 5 restrained him by putting Youth
A's hands behind his back. He said Supervisor came and told
Staff 5 to release Youth A. Youth A said afterwords he was very
upset and wanted to fight Staff 5, but Staff 5 was in the control
room at that time. Youth A said he got a scratch on his chest from
the incident and did receive medical care for the scratch.
Youth B was interviewed at the facility on 01/21/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Youth B recalled the incident
on 01/10/2025, and said he was goofing around with Youth A. He
reported Youth A got mad at Staff 5, tried to punch Staff 5, and
that’s when Staff 5 restrained Youth A. He denied witnessing Staff
5 scratch Youth A.
Youth C was interviewed at the facility on 01/21/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Youth C reported he
witnessed Staff 5 trying to stop Youth A from pushing through the
door and leaving the pod. Staff 5 grabbed Youth A’s shirt, Youth
A’s shirt ripped, and Youth A launched at Staff 5. He said Youth A
was trying to kick and hit Staff 5, so Staff 5 held Youth A’s arms
above his head. He did not witness Staff 1 push or scratch Youth
A.
8

Staff 5 was interviewed at the facility on 01/21/2025, in
collaboration DHHS Specialist. Staff 5 has been working at the
facility for 3 months and completed all new hire training including
MANDT training. Staff 5 reported on 01/10/2025 Youth A
attempting to push the door and leave the pod. Staff 5 said he
grabbed Youth A’s shirt and told to chill. Youth A jerked back and
that’s when his shirt ripped. He said Youth A got mad and started
to throw chairs. Staff 5 tried to verbally de-escalate Youth A and
that’s when Youth A tried to punch Staff 5. He grabbed Youth A
put him in a bear hug and lifted Youth A’s hands above his head
to stop Youth A from assaulting him. He said the restrain lasted
less than one minute. Supervisor came on the pod to assist; he
released Youth A and Supervisor counseled Youth A. Staff 5
denied scratching or injuring Youth A.
Supervisor was interviewed at the facility on 01/21/2025, in
collaboration DHHS Specialist. Supervisor reported she
responded to Pod D on 01/10/2025 due to Youth A being
escalated. She observed Staff 5 performing an improper restrain
on Youth A, because Staff 5 had Youth A’s hands held above his
head. She instructed Staff 5 to release Youth A. She said Youth A
was going after Staff 5, so she instructed Staff 5 to leave the pod.
She said Youth A was trying to take her keys to leave the pod, but
she was able to de-escalate Youth A and got him to calm down.
She talked to Youth A for a while after the incident and Youth A
did not report being injured or hurt because of the incident, and
she did not observe Youth A to have any injuries.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 01/10/2025 was reviewed. Youth A and Youth B
are observed talking Youth A goes towards the door Staff 1 grabs
his shirt, Staff 1 appears to be talking to Youth A, Youth A picks
up a chair throws at the ceiling, Staff 5 again appears to be trying
to talk to Youth A, Youth A swings at Staff 5, Staff 5 grabs Youth
A's arms and puts them above his head. Supervisor comes on the
pod and Staff 5 release Youth A hands.
Documents Reviewed:
• Unusual incident report dated 01/10/2025. Staff 1 was
upset, began throwing chairs at the ceiling, broke ceiling
tiles, Staff 5 attempted to verbally de-escalate, but was
unsuccessful. Youth A grabbed another chair to throw, Staff
1 placed Youth a in a one person hold, for 20 seconds.
Supervisor arrived on the scene and Staff 5 released Youth
9

A. Supervisor debriefed with Youth A and he went out with
no further incidences.
• Medical assessment note dated 01/10/2025. Youth A was
examined by Nurse. Youth A reported he throw a chair at
the ceiling and ceiling tile fell. Youth A was calm, denies
any pain or distress, and no bruises or injury noted.
• Facility Services Behavior Management System Policy,
Behavioral Intervention Techniques, Safe Physical 9
Intervention (Youth Restraint) Policy: Only the approved
SJJS safe physical management techniques may be used.
• The restraint holds that are trained through the MANDT
system are: Loose hold: two staff position themselves
behind a youth while holding a youth’s arms outward from
their body while all individuals are standing. Secure hold:
two staff stand behind a youth, holding the youth’s arms
from behind while he or she stands, then move the youth’s
forearms near his or her body to gain control. One-Person
side body hold: a staff attempts to hold the body of the
youth from the side while both are standing. Two-arm hold
that is the same as the one-arm hold, with the staff holding
youth’s wrists in front of the youth’s body. Two-person one-
arm hold that replicates the same effort as the one-arm
hold with a staff on either side of a standing youth.
• Staff 5 has no disciplinary record. Staff 5 completed
MANDT verbal de-escalation and physical skills training on
08/29/24 and 08/30/2024.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance based on video footage
and interviews conducted, Staff 5 did not utilize the correct
restraint technique within the facility’s approved restraint model.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR 2023C00000773SI dated 10/26/23; CAP approved 12/06/23
SIR 2024C00000854SI dated 12/06/23; CAP approved 01/18/24
Rule Code Health status assessment; notification; debriefing; reporting
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4163
Section (5) An agency will provide an incident report on a form prescribed
Description by the department for each incident involving the use of seclusion
or restraint. The initial report shall be submitted to the department
within 24 hours of the incident occurring. A final incident report
10

shall be submitted no later than 72 hours after the incident has
occurred.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation The facility did not provide an incident report on a form prescribed
by the department for each incident involving the use of restrain.
Investigation Documents Reviewed:
• Unusual incident reports dated 01/10/2025 and 01/12/2025
indicated Youth A was physically restrained.
• Facility Health Status assessment, notification, debriefing,
reporting policy: Incident involving restraint or seclusion will
be entered into MiSACWIS within 24 hours of the incident
occurring. The final report will be approved by the identified
approver no later than 72 hours after the incident occurred.
• MISACWIS was checked on 02/28/2025 and there is no
restrain reported entered for Youth A being restrained on
01/10/2025 and 01/12/2025.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as Youth A was restrained
on 01/10/2025 and 01/12/2025 the facility did complete an incident
report on the form prescribed by the Department.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR 2024C00000854SI dated 12/06/23; CAP approved 01/18/24
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and an acceptable corrective action plan is required.
March 11, 2025

Nabiha Rizk Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:

11
